channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Squire (Blue Dragon Support)/Page (Black Rose Support)
channel.description:
Name: Squire
Night Ability 1: Train Take the class of a deceased Blue Dragon player(Not any unique Classes or another Squire) from the graveyard - Infinite Uses
Passive: Unskilled Before you train, killers will not kill you, as you are not a threat to them
IF CONVERTED:
Name: Page
Night Ability 1: Train Take the class of a deceased player from the graveyard, but become the Black Rose version(Not King, Squire, Assassin, Mastermind or any class without a Black Rose Equivalent) - Infinite Uses
Passive: Unskilled Before you train, killers will not kill you, as you are not a threat to them
Lore: IDK
Comments: Basically BD/BR Aligned Amnesiac from ToS/SC2 Mafia, but I think it would work well

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Squire (Blue Dragon Support)/Page (Black Rose Support)
item.dc:creator: Alkander
item.description:
I love the idea, and would love to see this “copy dead persons class” mechanic in the game.

The only issue I’d have is the death immune mechanic.
When making a class you have to think about how people would play it/ play around its strengths and weaknesses. So here are my concerns:

  • The Squire could just sit there and be immune to death, and would actually be motivated to NOT “train” to a new role since if they did, they would lose their death immunity. Their best strategy would be to just hang out and wait till “late game” to finally take on a role and go from there. The Evils would just convert him if they find out he is death immune and would most likely end with him being on their side.

  • My Solution: Give him death/ night immunity but only for first 3 nights. This would motivate him to train himself onto one of the earlier dead targets, unless he wants to take on the risk and keep waiting for a better option.

I do love this class concept and it would be interesting if a Squire is put up for lynching and has to defend themselves as basically nothing. They could confirm by taking on a dead role then doing that action over multiple nights though. Very interesting. The unkillable at night just seems to strong, especially for someone who could be an Evil that is unkillable.

Read full topic
